item.title: Data management
item.description:
Learning outcomes

In this section, you will learn how to

  • ensure the analysis is reproducible
  • work coherently and efficiently with yourself
  • ensure the project can be understood by others (supervisors, collaborators, and future readers)
  • create a good work flow
  • enhance accuracy of work

Course notes

Slides can be downloaded (in PDF format) here.

Templates for do files

item.title: Data Clearance
item.description:
Learning outcomes

In this section, you will learn how to

  • set up working directory
  • import and save data
  • manage datasets
  • get to know the data
  • manage variables

Course notes

Slides can be downloaded (in pdf format) here.

Stata syntax in the slides

Stata codes be downloaded (do file) here.

item.title: Summary Statistics and Graphs
item.description:
Learning outcomes

In this section, you will learn how to

  • measure central tendency of the data (mean, median, amd mode)
  • measure dispersion of the data (range, interquartile range, variance, and standard deviation)
  • select suitable graphs to demonstrate the data
  • use Stata to create histograms, bar charts, box plots, scatter plots, and line graphs
  • customise graphs
  • export graphs in any format

Course notes

Slides can be downloaded (in pdf format) here.

Stata syntax in the slides

Stata codes be downloaded (do file) below

  • Summary statistics
  • Graphs

item.title: Tables and Interpreting results
item.description:
Learning outcomes

In this section, you will learn how to

  • make one-way and two by two tables
  • use Stata tool for Epidemiology
  • recapture basic epidemiology terms, including
    • rate, proportion
    • risk, risk difference, risk ratio
    • odds, odds ratio
  • interpret results of ratios
  • calculate ratios using Stata

Course notes

Slides can be downloaded (in pdf format) here.

Stata syntax in the slides

Stata codes be downloaded (do-file) at tab_results.
